alert.note: Alert for Armstrong (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 10:30AM EST until February 05 at 8:13AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in southwest Pennsylvania, Allegheny, Fayette, Greene, Washington and Westmoreland. In west central Pennsylvania, Armstrong and Indiana. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM EST, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensburg, Indiana, Uniontown, Jeannette, Latrobe, Connellsville, Homer City, Murrysville, California, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Irwin, Masontown, McChesneytown- Loyalhanna, Blairsville, Manor, Youngwood, Derry, Delmont and West Newton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
